method.name: Statistical two samples mean comparation Wilcoxon signed rank test

reference.ref: Wilcoxon, F. Individual Comparisons by Ranking Methods. Biometrics 1 (1945) 80-83
J.P. Royston. Algorithm AS 181. Applied Statistics 31:2 (1982) 176-180.

generalDescription.type: Statistical two sample means comparation using the Wilconxon signed rank test by mean of Stat-Clas-WilcoxonSR algorithm.
generalDescription.objective: Execution of StatTestClasRS test for comparing two classifier methods performance.
generalDescription.howWork: Stat-Clas-WilcoxonSR is a method for comparing the performance of two classification algorithms using statistics techniques. It can be used in k-folds and 5x2 cross validation training experiments. Stat-Clas-WilcoxonSR is associated to the training and testing results of the two models in an experiment that are to be compared. Once those models has been trained and tested, the Stat-Clas-WilcoxonSR takes place. The process calculates the percentage of correctly classified examples for each of the partitions results. The statistical sample includes all of those error measures for each method to be compared. Then the Wilconxon signed rank test is executed with the Null hypothesis as true if difference in means is equal to 0.

parameterSpec.param: signlevel: a value in the range (0,1). Default value: 0.95. The significance level represents the probability of erroneous rejecting the NULL Hypothesis.

method.example:
Problem type: Classification Methods to compare: Clas-ADLinear vs Clas-KNN Dataset: cleveland Type of partitions: k-fold, k=10 Default parameters
After the execution of RunKeel.jar we can see into the ./results/Stat-Clas-WilcoxonSR/TSTClas-ADLinear vs Clas-KNN/ folder the results0s0.stat file:
Wilcoxon signed rank test, Classification Classification error in each foldfold: Algorithm = 0 Fold 0 : 0.36666666666666664 Fold 1 : 0.36666666666666664 Fold 2 : 0.26666666666666666 Fold 3 : 0.3333333333333333 Fold 4 : 0.5 Fold 5 : 0.5 Fold 6 : 0.45161290322580644 Fold 7 : 0.45161290322580644 Fold 8 : 0.23333333333333334 Fold 9 : 0.5483870967741935 Algorithm = 1 Fold 0 : 0.4666666666666667 Fold 1 : 0.5666666666666667 Fold 2 : 0.4 Fold 3 : 0.4666666666666667 Fold 4 : 0.3333333333333333 Fold 5 : 0.5666666666666667 Fold 6 : 0.3870967741935484 Fold 7 : 0.5483870967741935 Fold 8 : 0.4666666666666667 Fold 9 : 0.4838709677419355 Null hypothesis, true difference in means is equal to 0 Output=0: There is no evidence against H0 p-valores: 0.09765027787937841
